Biography

Christiane Maria Heideh Amanpour is a British-Iranian journalist and television host. Amanpour is the Chief International Anchor for CNN and host of CNN International's nightly interview program Amanpour. She is also the host of Amanpour & Company on PBS.

Christiane Maria Heideh Amanpour was born in 1958 in England. She is the daughter of Mohammad Taghi and Patricia Anne Amanpour (n√©e Hill). Her father was Iranian Shi'ite Muslim, from Tehran. Her mother was a British Roman Catholic from Ealing, Middlesex. Chistiane's 4th great-grandfather was Mirza Mohammad Taghi, the Governor of Isfahan in the 1840s.

In 1998, she married James Rubin, a Jewish-American who served as US Assistant Secretary of State and spokesman for the US State Department during the Clinton administration and an informal adviser Hillary Clinton and to former president Barack Obama. Their son, Darius John Rubin, was born in 2000. The couple divorced in 2018.

Sources

"Reporting on the Reporters". "Finding Your Roots" written by Gates, Henry Louis Jr. Season 05 Episode 03 Kunhardt McGee Productions, Inkwell Films Ark Media 2012
